department.ch: 人力資源管理研究所碩士班

goal.en: The course provides foundational knowledge and contemporary issues of performance management. It aims to help students to: create an understanding of performance management, familiarize the methods of setting performance goals, providing performance feedback and evaluating performance result, and finally become professional performance management practitioners. Students in this course are required to read the content of text book and assigned readings before the class and to prepare the discussion in the class. Students are also required to as develop a performance management project for an organization. You are encouraged to share your ideas to others and challenge others’ standpoints for advancing your understandings in performance management.
goal.ch: 本課程旨在幫助同學們: 1. 建立對績效管理的觀念與知識 2. 熟悉與了解目標設定、績效回饋與評量績效結果的方法 3. 成為一個專業的績效管理實踐者

content.en:
1. Introduction of Performance management
2. Performance management and strategic planning
3. Defining Performance and Choosing Measurement Approach
4. Goal Setting – Management by Objective and OKR
5. Goal Setting-OGSM
6. Measuring Results-Balanced Score Card (BSC)
7. Performance Analytics
8. Rolling out the performance management system
9. Performance interview and feedback
10. Performance management and employee development
11. Performance Management and Rewards and Law
12. Project presentation
Please find the course detail information in the course schedule.

grading.en: Mid-term exam (20％): Mid-term exam is designed to check your understanding about the course content. The lecturer will decide the format of exam in accordance with students’ learning progress. Reading Summaries (20％): You will be working as a team (2-4 people in a team) to lead the discussion two/three times (depending on the number of students enrolled) in the course by providing a concise summary of the readings (at least 30 mins) and asking discussion questions to the class. Project presentation (20％): You have to work as a team to find a company and help it to setup/optimize its performance management system by applying the course content. You are required to make a 20 minutes presentation and a 10 min Q＆A session in the end of the course. Course Participation (20％): 1 point of course score will be deducted if students do not attend without pre-notice. The lecturer will evaluate students’ overall performance in the course (e.g. sharing ideas, asking questions, helping others in learning, tardiness) to determine the scores. Final Exam (20％): Final exam is designed to help the students to wrap up the content of the course. The lecturer will decide the format of exam in accordance with students’ learning progress.
